creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: three faces at L, torso at far R: face at far L is of an old man in profile with hooked nose and bushy beard wearing a hat; center head is a profile of a man facing L with a mustache and cap; man at R faces out to R, with bushy beard, cap; far R is angel-like figure with a pug nose and wavy hair, shirtless
marks:
Signature

-- inscribed in plate at lower right: monogram in plate, lower left: [SDB fec.]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Three Heads of Men Wearing Turbans and a Figure of a Nude Winged Woman, From Recueil de divers griffonnements et preuves, Plate 14
